availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Mann (hawkins co, TN, carpenter and corporal 1st KY Light artillery )

body.p: Hawkins County, Tennessee, carpenter and soldier. Stewart Tennessee native. Son of Elizabeth Mann. Married to Mariah M. Mann. Father of Jesse C. Mann, Zachariah Mann, Cleary Mann, William J. Mann, and Marion B. Mann. Laborer in Hawkins County, Tennessee, in 1850. Carpenter in Independence County, Arkansas, in 1860. Carpenter in 1864. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as private, artificer, and corporal, from September 10, 1863. Reported as deserted from Mt. Sterling, Kentucky, May 23, 1864. Returned to service and mustered out on July 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Hawkins County, District 6, p. 327A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Arkansas, Independence County, Christian, p. 290.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 510.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0148.
"John Chesterfield Mann (1829-1868)," Find A Grave, Memorial #77621019, accessed November 13, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/77621019 ().
